text: Love Fraud is an American true crime documentary miniseries, directed by Heidi Ewing and Rachel Grady. It revolves around Richard Scott Smith, who used the internet to prey upon women in search of love and conned them. It premiered on August 30, 2020, on Showtime. ==Plot== Richard Scott Smith used the internet to prey upon women searching for love, conning them out of money as his victims come together to find him. ==Episodes== ==Release== The series had its world premiere at the Sundance Film Festival on January 23, 2020. It premiered on August 30, 2020. It was initially set to premiere on May 8, 2020. However, it was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. ==Reception== On Rotten Tomatoes, the series holds an approval rating of 92% based on 24 reviews, with an average rating of 8/10. The website's critical consensus reads, "Explosive, but never exploitive, Love Fraud tells a thrilling tale of online dating gone terribly wrong with expert precision and a welcome dose of empathy."
